intro: Tococa pterocalyx, commonly known as the Amazonian beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking violet-blue berries that appear in clusters. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in the late afternoon. Its fruits are often consumed by birds and small mammals, aiding in seed dispersal. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
